ESCITALOPRAM

SELECTIVE SEROTONIN RE-UPTAKE INHIBITORS

  • Indications and doses
  • Drug action
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Renal impairment
  • Contra indications
  • Side effects
  • Administration
  • Patient and carer advice
  • Important safety information
  • Cautions
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Depressive illness, Generalised anxiety disorder, Obsessive-compulsive disorder,

By mouth

  • For adults
    10 mg once daily; increased if necessary up to 20 mg daily.
  • For adults elderly
    Initially 5 mg once daily; maximum 10 mg per day.

Panic disorder,

By mouth

  • For adults
    Initially 5 mg once daily for 7 days, then increased to 10 mg daily; maximum 20 mg per day.
  • For adults elderly
    Initially 2.5 mg once daily; maximum 10 mg per day.

Social anxiety disorder,

By mouth

  • For adults
    Initially 10 mg once daily for 2–4 weeks, dose to be adjusted after 2-4 weeks of treatment; usual dose 5–20 mg daily.

Drug action

Escitalopram is the active enantiomer of citalopram.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Initial dose 5 mg daily for 2 weeks, thereafter increased to max. 10 mg daily according to response; particular caution in severe impairment.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Caution if eGFR less than 30 mL/ minute/1.73m2.

Contra indications

  • QT-interval prolongation

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Abnormal dreams, fatigue, paraesthesia, pyrexia, restlessness, sinusitis, yawning,

uncommon: Alopecia, bruxism, confusion, epistaxis, menstrual disturbances, mydriasis, oedema, pruritus, syncope, tachycardia, taste disturbance, tinnitus,

rare: Aggression, bradycardia, depersonalisation,

notKnown: Hepatitis, paradoxical increased anxiety during initial treatment of panic disorder (reduce dose), postural hypotension, QT interval prolongation, thrombocytopenia,

Directions for administration

Oral drops can be mixed with water, orange juice, or apple juice before taking.

Advice for patients and carers

Counselling on administration of oral drops advised.

Important safety information

Depressive illness in children and adolescents

The balance of risks and benefits for the treatment of depressive illness in individuals under 18 years is considered unfavourable for escitalopram. Clinical trials have failed to show efficacy and have shown an increase in harmful outcomes. However, it is recognised that specialists may sometimes decide to use escitalopram in response to individual clinical need; children and adolescents should be monitored carefully for suicidal behaviour, self-harm or hostility, particularly at the beginning of treatment.

Cautions regarding administration

  • Susceptibility to QT-interval prolongation

Prepared medicinal forms of ESCITALOPRAM

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Tablet
Oral drops
